description: Migrated the Unitrans public website from Dell servers to Amazon Web Services (AWS) ECS2 instance to improve website performance for 40,000 daily riders in Davis
Fixed bugs and developed new features for improved user experience via Django framework.
Incorporated best accessibility practices to ensure the Unitrans public website met ADA compliance.
Created a docker container for the employee website to streamline development setup for new web programmers.
Managed both Unitrans public website and employee website databases via PostgreSQL.
Added multi-database support to OBA Docker image so that users of the container can run it with either PostgreSQL or MySQL.
Modified OBA Docker image to run without root privileges to improve security for transit agencies.
Researched and applied findings to help run the real-time transit software, OneBusAway (OBA), in a Docker container to help facilitate an easier transit experience for Unitrans’s 40,000 daily riders.
Projected to deploy OneBusAway’s Docker Instance on Azure to help facilitate an easier transit experience for Unitrans’ riders.
Developed website utilizing WordPress CMS with PHP, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
Led a team of developers in the content management and structure of the website.
Contributed to the creation of documentation for managing the website.
Developed Information Architecture for the website.
Conducted successful Migration once website development concluded.
Worked with Active Directory to set up new computers for various departments for ASUCD.
Managed Amazon Web Services (AWS) EC2 instances for various websites under ASUCD.
Created a development website for Unitrans public website using the Linux, NGINX, MySQL, and PHP (LEMP) stack.
Configured and installed computers for various departments within ASUCD.
